intro: Baptistonia truncata, commonly known as the cut-leaved bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant native to North America. It is characterized by its floating leaves that are typically cut or notched at the edges. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often submerged or floating. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments. Baptistonia truncata is a member of the Lentibulariaceae family, which includes other carnivorous plants.
